newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian palm oil surges on China import news.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian palm oil surges on China import news.

text.p: PALMOIL FUTURES PALMOIL PHYSICALS
Nov (3rd pos) 1,196 rgt/tonne Aug (south) 1,220 *
Open/hi/low 1,159/1,200/1,159 Prev close 1,190
Prev settlement 1,160 * sellers prices

PALMOIL FUTURES - Prices surged on news China has approved imports of 1.3 million tonnes of palm oil. Afternoon values further boosted by talk India's STC is seeking to buy up to 250,000 tonnes palm oil for Sep/Oct shipment. Immediate upside seen capped at 1,200.
PALMOIL PHYSICALS - Also firmed on increased buying in afternoon. Trades confined to crude palm oil and palm olein.
Traders said purchases from China would further boost Malaysian exports which have been expected to remain healthy in the next few months.

Afternoon prices were further boosted by talk that India's State Trading Corporation (STC) was in the market for up to 250,000 tonnes of palm oil for September/October shipment. This was denied by an STC official in Singapore.
Traders said the STC was unlikely to be buying such a huge quantity as its purchases have been in lots of 6,000 tonnes.
"It was not shown in its purchases so far if it's going to buy such a huge amount," a dealer said.
The STC last bought 6,000 tonnes of palm olein on Wednesday for last half September shipment.
Traders also doubted whether China's approval of the import quota would translate into real deals.
They said high palm oil prices would deter Chinese importers, who have been buying cheaper soybean oil and had no immediate need to switch to palm oil.
"Just because they have been allowed to import palm oil does not mean they have to buy," said a trader who has done deals with China. "China will not pay at these prices."
Benchmark third position Nov crude palm oil futures closed up 36 ringgit at 1,196 ringgit ($479.74) a tonne. Traders said immediate upside for the contract could be capped at 1,200.
Total turnover on the futures market swelled to 3,902 lots against 2,035 on Thursday.
Physical Aug (south) crude palm oil was offered at 1,220 ringgit ($489.37) a tonne with bids at 1,215. It was traded from 1,200 to 1,220.
Aug (central) was offered at 1,205 ringgit with bids at 1,195, and Aug (north) saw offers at 1,195 and bids at 1,180.
Oct (south) crude palm oil was offered at 1,230 ringgit with bids at 1,220, after trading from 1,200 to 1,225.
Oct (central) saw offers at 1,215 ringgit and bids at 1,200, and Nov (south) was offered at 1,230 with bids at 1,220.
Among refined products, Sep RBD palm olein was offered at $575 a tonne, FOB Malaysia, Oct at $565 and Nov/Dec at $560. Oct was traded at $560 and Nov/Dec from $550 to $557.
Sep/Oct RBD palm oil was offered at $530.
RBD palm stearin and palm fatty acid distillate were unquoted.
